contextId.information: This can be stated in a positive form. AT: "that your righteousness must exceed ... in order to enter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: that unless your righteousness exceeds ... you will in no way enter

contextId.information: This can be stated in a positive form. AT: "your Father knows when even one sparrow dies and falls to the ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: not one of them falls to the ground without your Father's knowledge

contextId.information: "he taught them nothing except by parables." The double negative can be expressed in a positive way. AT: "everything he taught them he said in parables" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: he said nothing to them without a parable

contextId.information: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "you must change ... in order to enter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: unless you turn ... you will in no way enter

contextId.information: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "while also obeying the less important laws" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: and not to have left the other undone
